title: The Learjet 45 landing gear system consists of 2 main gears …
caption_en: The Learjet 45 landing gear system consists of 2 main gears and 1 nose gear. The retractable landing gears are electrically controlled and hydraulically operated. The controls and the gear status lights are located on the GEAR control panel.

title: Control Panel This is located at the forward center instrume…
caption_en: Control Panel This is located at the forward center instrument panel.

title: The other switch indicators on this panel are for the Nose W…
caption_en: The other switch indicators on this panel are for the Nose Wheel Steering system, Anti-Skid system, the Auxiliary hydraulic pump and the Hydraulic Cross Flow valve XFLOW).

title: Nose Gear The nose gear consists of an air-hydraulic shock s…
caption_en: Nose Gear The nose gear consists of an air-hydraulic shock strut with an internal self - centering device.

title: An internal mechanical lock inside the actuator holds the ge…
caption_en: An internal mechanical lock inside the actuator holds the gear extended if hydraulic pressure is relieved or lost. Once engaged, the internal lock can only be unlocked by applying hydraulic pressure to the retract side of the actuator.

title: The nose gear strut has a self-centering mechanism consistin…
caption_en: The nose gear strut has a self-centering mechanism consisting of 2 cams.

title: An up-lock roller is attached on the forward side of the nos…
caption_en: An up-lock roller is attached on the forward side of the nose gear strut. When the nose landing gear is retracted, a spring-loaded up-lock hook engages this up-lock roller.

title: The up-lock hook is released hydraulically during normal ext…
caption_en: The up-lock hook is released hydraulically during normal extension and mechanically via cables during a free-fall extension.

title: The 2 nose gear doors are mechanically linked to the shock s…
caption_en: The 2 nose gear doors are mechanically linked to the shock strut and move with the nose gear. The tubeless nose wheel tire has dual chines.

title: Main Gear Each main gear has an air- hydraulic shock strut, …
caption_en: Main Gear Each main gear has an air- hydraulic shock strut, 2 wheels and 2 squat switches.

title: An internal mechanical lock inside each gear actuator holds …
caption_en: An internal mechanical lock inside each gear actuator holds the gear down and locked if hydraulic pressure is relieved or lost. Once in place, the internal lock can only be unlocked by applying hydraulic pressure to the retract side of the actuator.

title: Main Gear Doors When the main gears are retracted, the inboa…
caption_en: Main Gear Doors When the main gears are retracted, the inboard and outboard doors enclose them.

title: The inboard doors are electrically controlled and hydraulica…
caption_en: The inboard doors are electrically controlled and hydraulically operated by an inboard door actuator. The inboard doors are held latched by a door hook. The hook holds the door in place when hydraulic pressure is removed from the door actuator. The hook can be unlocked hydraulically or mechanically.

title: Wheel Assembly Each main gear has 2 aluminium wheel assembli…
caption_en: Wheel Assembly Each main gear has 2 aluminium wheel assemblies. Each wheel assembly has a brake unit. 3 fusible plugs are installed on each wheel hub and they melt at a temperature of C.

title: If the wheel assembly temperature exceeds C after a heavy br…
caption_en: If the wheel assembly temperature exceeds C after a heavy braking, the 3 fusible plugs will melt. This will cause the tire to deflate, preventing a tire blow-out.

title: Squat Switch System Some airplane systems operate only on th…
caption_en: Squat Switch System Some airplane systems operate only on the ground while some operate only in the air.

title: When the airplane is on the ground and the struts are compre…
caption_en: When the airplane is on the ground and the struts are compressed, the squat switches provide a ground mode signal. When the airplane lifts off, the main landing gear struts extend and the squat switches send an air mode signal.

title: The squat switches provide ground or air signals directly to…
caption_en: The squat switches provide ground or air signals directly to the thrust reversers system, spoiler system, landing gear control, brake control unit and the squat switch relay panel

title: The in turn, provides airground signals to many systems. The…
caption_en: The in turn, provides airground signals to many systems. They include the digital electronic engine computers (DEEC) for idle schedules, stall warning system, nose wheel steering system, cabin pressurisation system, crew warning panel and the weather radar.

title: Landing Gear Indications The landing gear operations are seq…
caption_en: Landing Gear Indications The landing gear operations are sequenced through the landing gear control valve module. This module is powered by the DC Emergency Battery bus through the GEAR circuit breaker.

title: The emergency battery bus power enables a normal gear extens…
caption_en: The emergency battery bus power enables a normal gear extension in the event of a dual generator failure. The gear control switch and gear status indications are on the GEAR control panel.

title: The gear position indicating system consists of 3 split indi…
caption_en: The gear position indicating system consists of 3 split indicators that shows the status of the nose and main gears. The top half of each indicator is the gear advisory annunciator. A gear down and locked indication is shown above.

title: Gear Advisory Annunciator ( black and white diagonal stripes…
caption_en: Gear Advisory Annunciator ( black and white diagonal stripes ) For the Nose Gear, this is displayed when the gear is in transit, that is - when the nose gear is Not Up and Locked or - is Not Down and Locked.

title: For the Main Gear, the respective annunciation is displayed …
caption_en: For the Main Gear, the respective annunciation is displayed if - its main gear inboard door is Not Closed and Latched or - the main gear actual position disagrees with the landing gear control switch selection.

title: A DOWN green light on the bottom half indicates that the gea…
caption_en: A DOWN green light on the bottom half indicates that the gear is down and locked.
